aec7cec5-159b-4f9d-a2b6-aa6cd8f9aa1c.description: Students who earn the Honors Critical Thinking credential are accepted into the Honors study due to their level of academic commitment. They exemplify leadership qualities through their academic coursework and critical thinking skills and maintain a GPA of 3.0 or above. Contact: Professor Robert Humphrey, Fulton Campus Robert.Humphrey@cayuga-cc.edu or Professor Sheila Myers, Auburn Campus Sheila.Myers@cayuga-cc.edu
aec7cec5-159b-4f9d-a2b6-aa6cd8f9aa1c.name: Honors Critical Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Hon 101 - Critical Thinking Seminar; Hon 202 - Capstone Experience; participation in the SUNY Applied Research Conference and other capstone experience as determined by Honors Advisor.

daa9246d-0d1a-4feb-960b-24a228bef7f0.description: Students who earn the Honors Leadership credential are accepted into the Honors study due to their level of academic commitment. They exemplify leadership qualities through their academic coursework and leadership role at the college and maintain a GPA of 3.0 or above. Contact: Professor Robert Humphrey, Fulton Campus Robert.Humphrey@cayuga-cc.edu or Professor Sheila Myers, Auburn Campus Sheila.Myers@cayuga-cc.edu
daa9246d-0d1a-4feb-960b-24a228bef7f0.name: Honors Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Hon 101 - Critical Thinking Seminar; Hon 202 - Capstone Experience; Two honors study electives or one elective and role as student club officer, community service, or peer tutor as determined by Honors Advisor.

f7429c6c-c90d-4ec0-a4e0-8c0fde993885.description: By participating in these interactive and engaging leadership training sessions, students will identify key qualities of a good leader, identify career and life goals, gain the skills necessary to effectively work in groups and identify transferable skills for the workforce.
f7429c6c-c90d-4ec0-a4e0-8c0fde993885.name: Leadership Training

badge_template_activities.title: These objectives will be met through participation in a series of engaging workshops provided by trained facilitators. Students will demonstrate their learning through reflection activities, evaluations, and self-assessments.

63a2e7cc-5f7c-43a1-90a7-23c252297b5e.description: Earners of the EMS Fundamentals prepare for entry positions in industrial facilities, specifically those that require operation of hydraulics, pneumatics and electrical motor controls and associated precision measurement tools. Earners are able to read and interpret basic electrical and mechanical schematics to troubleshoot, perform calculations used in the trade, and demonstrate communication skills for the workplace. Contact Emily Cameron for information emily.cameron@cayuga-cc.edu
63a2e7cc-5f7c-43a1-90a7-23c252297b5e.name: Electro-Mechanical System Fundamentals

skills.name: Able To Work With And Maintain Electrical Motor Controls

ee732e4b-a4fb-445a-80ba-1a9c5fc46b77.description: Demonstrated ability to provide client support, troubleshooting and desktop support skills. Proficiency in computer hardware, client and desktop support, and office applications. Prerequisite: CS120 or related computer experience for CS 225. Contact Professor Barry Fitzgerald for more information: fitzgerald@cayuga-cc.edu
ee732e4b-a4fb-445a-80ba-1a9c5fc46b77.name: IT Support

54b7c2f7-f93f-447c-b603-cda4c6681969.description: Students that complete this credential have taken a career assessment to identify career specific and general employment skills as well as career and employment goals. They have knowledge of employment advice from real-world employers. Contact: Meg Osborne osbornem@cayuga-cc.edu
54b7c2f7-f93f-447c-b603-cda4c6681969.name: Career Goals

badge_template_activities.title: Students participate in a skills assessment assignment including Jung Typology or MyNextMove.Org. They have identified five skills that are transferable to a career, and listened to actual employers talk about what skills they are seeking when they recruit.

9bfdc48d-a16e-4064-9862-c567b5a05d52.description: Achievement of Level II competency for teaching assistant at the K-12 level. Demonstrated understanding of educational theories and styles of learning and the American educational system. Able to employ effective communication strategies in the classroom. Pre-cursor to achievement is Level I competency. Contact Professor Eric Zizza for more information: Zizza@cayuga-cc.edu
9bfdc48d-a16e-4064-9862-c567b5a05d52.name: Teaching Assistant Level II

alignments.name: Teaching Assistant NYS
alignments.description: New York State Standards for Teaching Assistant Certification.

badge_template_activities.title: EDU 202: Foundations of American Education (3 credits)

skills.name: Adopting Appropriate Communication Style For The Situation

2428af13-2aea-4079-b2cf-c7764ddeea5b.description: Students who achieve this credential have developed strategies for protecting their online employment reputation and built networking connections through Linkedin and other career networking sites. They have developed valuable communication skills necessary when interviewing with potential employers. Contact: Sheila Myers sheila.myers@cayuga-cc.edu
2428af13-2aea-4079-b2cf-c7764ddeea5b.name: Career Connections

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in the activities assigned for the badge including, managing an online reputation, developing a Linkedin profile, and participating in a mock interview. All activities are assessed by a staff person from the Center for Career and Applied Learning.

4816c039-9425-48d9-98a8-f1fafddcb3ea.description: Students who achieve this credential have crafted an effective resume and cover letter. They've identified the steps of an effective job search and learned the stages of the interview process. Contact: Meg Osborne osbornem@cayuga-cc.edu
4816c039-9425-48d9-98a8-f1fafddcb3ea.name: Career Professionalism

badge_template_activities.title: Students are assessed on completion of assigned tasks including job searches, resume development, and answering basic interview questions.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships
How To Search For A Job

b1e23474-709a-4efb-b95b-f4a0ebb9fc20.description: Earners of the “Events Planning” badge have the basic knowledge to start a business as an event planner. Students demonstrate that they can effectively plan events such as corporate events, conferences, workshops, celebrations and conventions through traditional and contemporary marketing approaches. Additionally, students have an understanding of the steps involved in starting their own event planning business. For more information contact Professor Eric Zizza zizza@cayuga-cc.edu
b1e23474-709a-4efb-b95b-f4a0ebb9fc20.name: Events Planning

badge_template_activities.title: • BUS 248: Event Planning (3 credits) • ENTR 200: The Entrepreneurial Process (3 credits) • BUS 216: Personal Selling (3 credits)

140ef13b-048e-4dea-afbb-5817501dfc69.description: Earners of this badge will demonstrate a basic knowledge of Accounting Principles and Fraud Recognition. Earners will be able to prepare Financial Statements and analyze them to detect fraud. Recommended course but not required is CJ 111 - Intro to Justice Systems. Contact Dawn Matijas-Czolowski Matijas@cayuga-cc.edu for more information.
140ef13b-048e-4dea-afbb-5817501dfc69.name: Accounting Fraud Recognition Skills

38546767-b5a2-459f-baf7-deadc2fb10f7.description: Students experience the publishing process from an editor's perspective. They edit in teams under strict deadlines, and publish a literary journal effectively. They practice arrangement, proofreading, and layout, and receive the endorsement of Cayuga Community College's writing faculty.
38546767-b5a2-459f-baf7-deadc2fb10f7.name: Literary Journal Publisher

badge_template_activities.title: One course from the following Creative and Professional Writing electives: Engl 120 Being Writers, Engl 211 Creative Writing, Engl 270 Tech Writing, or Engl 238-239 Special Topics

Recommendation by a writing faculty member for work completed on Cayuga's creative arts journal: Listen. Contact Professor Richard Brower - bowerR@cayuga-cc.edu or Professor Mark Montgomery -Montgomery@cayuga-cc.edu

b9c32c9e-2b36-485f-a819-0e920027db63.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office, QuickBooks, Peachtree and tax software. Earners are able to use Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access, set up a company’s accounting records and perform accounting functions in both QuickBooks and Peachtree. Earners have knowledge of current Federal tax laws and federal and state forms and filings requirements for small businesses. Contact Dawn Matijas-Czolowski matijas@cayuga-cc.edu for more information.
b9c32c9e-2b36-485f-a819-0e920027db63.name: Accounting & Tax Skills

8e560ac4-1980-4c20-b646-70639539a2c8.description: Successfully demonstrated proficiency in a variety of business application software and has achieved the skills necessary for an office environment. Contact Professor Liz McCormick for more information: mccormick@cayuga-cc.edu
8e560ac4-1980-4c20-b646-70639539a2c8.name: Business Applications

feab0cef-41e9-454c-9875-6b0f92a684ae.description: Develop the foundations of creative writing and storytelling by reading the literary classics and applying that knowledge to the creative writing process. For those who want to utilize writing for imaginative endeavors.
feab0cef-41e9-454c-9875-6b0f92a684ae.name: Creative Writing and Imagination

alignments.name: Association of Writers and Writing Programs
alignments.description: A series of Hallmarks for member programs, teachers, and conferences. For degree-conferring programs in creative writing, these hallmarks serve to establish professional standards for the field, reinforce AWP’s commitment to excellence in teaching, and reflect our continued support of writers in the academy.

badge_template_activities.title: Creative Writing 211 and two literature courses with writing intensive (WI).

503fffc1-8957-4573-a176-2490dc479f38.description: Earners of the “Destination Marketing” badge demonstrate that they can effectively market a destination through traditional and contemporary marketing approaches. Students successfully market a destination utilizing publicity, advertising, and social media marketing tools. For more information contact: Professor Eric Zizza zizza@cayuga-cc.edu
503fffc1-8957-4573-a176-2490dc479f38.name: Destination Marketing

badge_template_activities.title: • BUS 255 Tourist Destinations (3 credits) • BUS 254 Marketing for Hospitality and Tourism (3 credits) • BUS 232 Introduction to Social Media Marketing (3 credits)

d9453bd8-0135-48b3-a3ef-9279869da39f.description: Completion of an educational program based on dialogue to understand issues of diversity and inclusion. Cultural sensitivity, diversity, equity, inclusion, anti-racism and social justice help all members of the community feel included and part of a common effort.
d9453bd8-0135-48b3-a3ef-9279869da39f.name: Diversity Competency

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in a series of workshops on diversity, equity and inclusion.

77983367-fc84-4958-a9b3-ad2bd24f3626.description: Earners of the “Marketing Events” badge demonstrate that they can effectively plan and market events such as corporate events, conferences, workshops, celebrations and conventions through traditional and contemporary marketing approaches. Students successfully plan and market an authentic event utilizing publicity, advertising, and social media marketing tools. For more information contact Professor Eric Zizza Zizza@cayuga-cc.edu
77983367-fc84-4958-a9b3-ad2bd24f3626.name: Marketing Events

badge_template_activities.title: • BUS 248: Event Planning (3 credits) • BUS 254 Marketing for Hospitality and Tourism (3 credits) • BUS 232 Introduction to Social Media Marketing (3 credits)

d8f0ed6f-abb7-4d0f-81d9-f6df045edb13.description: The earner of this badge has a fundamental understanding of network design, support, administration, and troubleshooting. Prerequisite: CS120 or related computer experience for CS 225, CS 237. Contact Professor Barry Fitzgerald for more information: fitzgerald@cayuga-cc.edu
d8f0ed6f-abb7-4d0f-81d9-f6df045edb13.name: Networking

6290d372-3c12-404c-82ba-529a7f90f7f0.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated the basic level of accounting and financial statement preparation for a profit and non-profit business. Earners are able to prepare and analyze financial statements for both a profit and non-profit business. Contact Dawn Matijas-Czolowski matijas@cayuga-cc.edu for more information.
6290d372-3c12-404c-82ba-529a7f90f7f0.name: Non-Profit Accounting Skills

a78bde74-9b96-4015-8989-1a119f0e4654.description: Achievement of Level III competency for teaching assistant at the K-12 level. A demonstrated understanding of educational theories and styles of learning and the American educational system. Ability to employ effective communication strategies in the classroom. Pre-cursor required: Level I and II proficiency. Contact Professor Eric Zizza for more information: Zizza@cayuga-cc.edu
a78bde74-9b96-4015-8989-1a119f0e4654.name: Teaching Assistant Level III

alignments.name: Teaching Assistant NYS
alignments.description: New York State requirements for Teaching Assistant Certification.

badge_template_activities.title: PSY 215: Child Psychology (3 credits) or PSY 216: Adolescent Psychology (3 credits)
PSY 217: Introduction to Children with Exceptionalities (3)
